name: Ski Time Square Condominiums

reviews.text: We stayed at the Ski Time Square Condominiums at Steamboat Resort for a week at the end of February 2013. Overall, especially given the price we paid as returning guests, we were in no way disappointed. There were minor glitches, but there was a lot of value compared to other properties. We would do it again.
reviews.title: Reasonably comfortable, reasonably convenient, reasonably priced. That's plenty good enough

reviews.text: Ski Time Square is an older complex, built in 1972, and portions have been razed to make room for newer, upscale properties. The remaining building has been gently upgraded, but you need to know that each individual unit is privately owned, so your experience may vary. In our case, we were in a unit on the third flor that had been renovated somewhat piecemeal, but was just fine... Decent living room furnishings, a flat screen TV, a dining room set comfortable for four, and a small but functional kitchen. The kitchen was key to our experience, because it meant we could prepare a decent breakfast before we hit the slopes. Nothing fancy but everything we needed for casual meals. The refrigerator was struggling to keep up with freezing temperatures.. But again, privately owned units and I get the economics in play... Everything else was well maintained.
reviews.title: classic condo
Great location
reviews.text: The bedrooms -- one half a level up, one a full level down -- were fine... One with a single and a double, and one with a queen, they were more than fine to retreat to after a long day on the mountain. The mattresses were uniformly tired but everything was clean and well maintained. The only significant issue was an intermittently chirping CO detector which needed new batteries and interrupted our sleep a couple nights.

And the location? Well.. Yeah, hard to beat for the price, maybe anywhere in the West this season. Ski Time Square is a brisk but pleasant five minute walk from the gondola and Gondola Square... It is also nearly-ski-in, ski-out... If you walk out the uphill side and past the Kutuk building, then through the T-Bar parking lot, you can click in and ski down to the gondola quite easily, maybe 150 yards and a short, flat runout. Coming back, you angle right off of Vogue and down toward the old double chair (the trail section is called Headwall and it connects with the runout called Right-of-Way), then cut out at the T-Bar parking area to make your way home. Even better, rent from Steamboat Ski and Sport at Ski Time Square, and you can leave your gear at the Kutuk building and not hump it all the way back to the building. The staff are friendly and helpful and your boots spend the night on the boot dryer while you walk upstairs in your shoes. Everybody wins.
reviews.title: Still a great value and great location after many stays
Not what we Hoped for.
reviews.text: Overall, our experience with Ski Time Square Condominiums was quite positive. You won't mistake it for luxury, but you can probably eat well all week for what you save over other properties, and in the end, it was everything we needed in a convenient package. We would stay there again.

description: Ski Time Square is in the heart of the ski village with shopping, dining and après ski entertainment just steps away, and the slopes a short walk right across the street. One of Steamboats most popular vacation properties, these studio, one, two, and two-bedroom plus loft condominiums are an excellent value with an unmatched location. Ski Time Square makes it easy for you to conveniently rendezvous with friends and family morning, noon and night.
